commit.title: Fix Fast-Weights model (A computed every t)
literally just removing a print statement (#164)
Fix locals and layer norm gradient edge case. (#154)
Fix gradients of sinh and cosh (#145)
Small cleanup, and updates to boolean funcs in util
Add layers argument to support reloading and fix iteration upper bound. (#143)
Fix wrong zero gradient for assignment in direct mode (#139)
Add batch norm option to LSTM. (#142)
Avoid packing and then unpacking again (#141)
Can now request dot file of entire graph (#103)
Remove totem dependency (torch now has its own tester) (#124)
prevent infinite recursion in number operation
Expose the nn object in wrapper
Print error occurred when parsing generated code.
Add missing pow operator in generated code.
implementation of RNN layer with GRU units
Handle functions with many model object inputs.
Fix some bad global refs, Lua 5.3 support.
Missing gradcheck for recurrent lstm, outputtype=all
x:view(), x:viewAs(), x:expand() and x:expandAs() all work
Testing floating point for view and expand, both work
Fix a typo in README.md (modelf -> sigmoid)
Exclude more test from direct mode.
Move gradient intermediates out of graph structure.
Clean up gradient handling in optimize mode.
Fix inlining bug with literal tables.
Move our fill method from torch to util.
metatable and type as static functions
fixed assertion in GradGrad test. Also added SimpleGradGrad test
Overloads for __newindex and __index work in Direct.
Merge branch 'awiltschko/assignment' of github.com:twitter/torch-autograd into awiltschko/assignment
Using skip functionality for direct mode gradgrad test
Using totem functions for tensor comparisons
Working padding function gradients (but now max fails, investigating)
adding test for grad of grad
Util.cat works with all tensor types
Make the CatNumber test a little more interesting
Fix typo in stable grad copy.
Use double in tests unless specifically testing float functionality
All other methods unsupported for torch classes.
Update doc on nn wrapping and functionalizing.
Error for stable grads in direct mode.
Small bug fix that affects our internal distrib.
Fixed error when finding gradient of function containing scalar multiply
CuDNN support for CNNs, added AlexNet
t() and transpose() now have their original meanings
Casting to have float test pass
Added a cast method for nested params
Benchmarks working, but slower. Might be from type-casting
All tests passing, moving onto examples and benchmarks
Everything working except for the stacked models
Track tensor lifetime, allow intra-function reuse.
Expanded dot test, added outer product gradient and test
Add a bit of documentation for gradients of gradients.
Fix param sorting issue in optim.
Allow simple : operator usage on tensors.
Fix empty tables being removed from parameter list.
Added generated code to debug docs.
Make AutoModules and AutoCriteria clonable, savable and loadable.
Fix functionalize on module when parameters() returns nil.
Just one possible fix for Readme.md
Table inputs for NN modules works
Relying on latest nn for tests + running benchmarks.
Convert sub operator to add + unm.
More unit tests, deeper coverage for optimizer.
Need a default handler for nn.functionalize()
Fix N^2 tensor matching, other optimizations.
Fix a typo involving package LICENSE
Better heuristic to wrap nn modules (LookupTable).
Fixed gradcheck (LuaJIT behavior differs from Lua).
Fixed LSTM param update (LuaJIT behavior diff from Lua)
Preferring W over x when auto typing.
Fixed the debugger from tripping on new memory.
Debugger JSON output and generated code support.
Fixed issue with cat, LSTM training properly.
Add AutoModule and AutoCriterion (build any nn.Module and nn.Criterion from a function).
Using CMake to simplify file inclusion.
Added stability perturbation to logBCELoss. Fixed up autoencoder example.
Moved losses from util to loss.
Re-organized models: one model per file.
Added transpose (only callable as torch.t right now)
Commenting out mnist-specific stuff for now.
Added a benchmark for wrapped modules.
Ability to wrap existing nn modules.
Forcing contiguous gradients in view gradfun
Fix torch.index, it wouldn't work for 1D tensors.
Extraneous getValue in LSTM network not necessary
size and new are now members of a node.
util.lookup() with support for arbitrary dims / batches.
Simplifying LSTM training -> sparse lookup table will come later.
Returning nil gradients escapes gradient accumulation
Working copy. Had to change call signature, because we currently disallow inplace operations
Prevent benchmarks from erroring out if you don't have the newest torch branch
Simplified RNN+LSTM parameters (merged them into a single W+b).
Full batching implemented in LSTM demo.
Rewrote LSTM and RNN to support batches.
LSTM using cat to avoid table states.
Gradient capping based on norm instead of max.
Full CUDA support for PENN demo.
New test for torch.cat (commented for now).
Learning rate schedule for Penn example.
Add fast path for common unbroadcast case.
Fixed training in LSTM, working now.
All tests passing. Problem was initializing grads to 0, not zeros_like
Added wrapper for Penn Treebank dataset.
Proper tic/toc for GPU + CUDA support + pre-allocs.
Cleaned up nnfunc deps: no more.
Added minimal test case for the re-used scalar problem
Two reference implementations: RNN and LSTM.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:twitter-cortex/autograd into alex/grads
Shouldn't pass gradient on, need to pass zero, I think for 2nd arg view fn
Fixed bug where torch inputs didn't work
More transparent book-keeping for model generators.
Updated other mnist examples to use multiple return values
Multiple return values supported from gradient function
Factored node and number out of main
Filled up README for initial release.
Minor fix to make demos cwd-independent.
Adding tests. Weight matrices are transposed from what I'd expect?
Exporting gradient functions so we can register at call-time
Secretly providing node methods so that we can test nodes
Switched to moses map and filter
Cleaned up tests; moved mnist to examples.
House style is camelCase, not ragEcasE
Working MNIST example. On to gradcheck.
Working, needs gradcheck, and working examples
Propagating gradients to tables. Very useful for organization and sanity.
Metamethods overriden on float and double torch tensors.
Still disorganized. Working add,mul,cmul,pow,exp,tanh,abs,sum. Now to build simple examples next.
